title: FIPS mode
content:
FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) are a set of standards that describe document processing, encryption algorithms, and other information technology standards for use within U.S. non-military government agencies and by U.S. government contractors and vendors who work with the agencies. FIPS is also considered a good standard for all companies that seek a high security standard. 

FIPS 140-2, “Security Requirements for Cryptographic Modules,” was issued by the U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in May 2001. The standard specifies the security requirements for cryptographic modules utilized within a security system that protects sensitive or valuable data.

This guide provides guidelines for installing and running OpenText Service Management in FIPS mode. It is strongly recommended that you follow the guidelines strictly to avoid any unforeseen risk that may be introduced by the FIPS solution. 

In this release, FIPS mode support is under controlled availability, where our Product Management team will work with customers to review the planned implementation. Contact our Product Management team before you start the implementation.

Supported services

This release supports FIPS mode for the following services (which use FIPS-certified libraries) with the limitations listed in the table below:

  • Service Management Automation
  • Service Portal
  • Mobile app (iPhone only—see Security Certifications and Compliance Centre)
  • UD/UCMDB (containerized only), including UD

Limitations

When OpenText Service Management is running in FIPS mode, the following features are not supported, or they still work in non-FIPS mode, or they have additional requirements.

Services Feature Not supported  Still work in non-FIPS mode Have additional requirements
IdM IdM Admin Portal ✓
Service Management Automation (SMA) Smart Virtual Agent ✓
Field-level encryption ✓ (disabled)
On-Premises Bridge (OPB)-based integrations ✓
Internal PostgreSQL ✓
Tenant encryption keycode (which is used for the "Encrypted string" data type in user options,) Must be at least 14 characters long to run in FIPS mode
Download link of the UCMDB push adapter ✓
Installation and upgrade related services ✓
Containerized UD/UCMDB 2 Data Flow Probe (DFP) downloader (Windows and Linux) and 1 Local Client downloader ✓
Solr-based search ✓

Supported deployments

This release supports FIPS mode only for NEW deployments on AWS GovCloud. See Support matrix for EKS deployment.

  • You enable FIPS mode during the installation at the instance level, not the tenant level. 
  • Once enabled, FIPS mode can't be disabled.  
  • You can't upgrade an existing non-FIPS deployment to FIPS mode.

How to enable FIPS mode

The following describes the procedure to enable FIPS mode. 

Install OpenText Service Management on GovCloud with FIPS mode enabled

See Deploy the suite on GovCloud (FIPS mode).

Install containerized UD/UCMDB on GovCloud with FIPS mode enabled

See (Optional) Install containerized UD/UCMDB on GovCloud (FIPS mode).
